headline: BNY asks employees to return to office four days a week by September
summary: Bank of New York Mellon has asked its employees to return to the office four days a week by September 2 from a current three days, according to a memo from the bank's executive committee seen by Reuters.  JPMorgan Chase prompted staff complaints after it told workers on hybrid schedules to come back five days a week starting in March.  BNY has required its 51,000 employees to work from the office for three days a week since the first half of 2023.
